Row.Text: Your Trade Routes to an Ally's city provide +2 Gold for both cities.

Robb is his father's son, with a keen sense of honor and justice. He shares his father's devotion to honor and is frequently accompanied by his direwolf, Grey Wind, whom he always takes with him into battle.
This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.

Ser Edmure Tully is the son of Lord Hoster Tully and Lady Minisa Whent, and the heir to House Tully of Riverrun, the liege lords of the riverlands. He is the younger brother of Catelyn and Lysa. As a youth, he was known as hot-headed but good-hearted.
Does not have any movement cross cost when crossing rivers.

Lysa convinced her husband to give Petyr control of customs at Gulltown around 289 AC, where he increased incomes tenfold, displaying his skill with finances.Jon Arryn, Hand of the King for King Robert I Baratheon, eventually brought Petyr to court in King's Landing, and within three years, he was named master of coin and appointed to the small council. Lysa after the wedding with Petyr names him the Lord Protector of the Vale.
+1 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.

Tywin Lannister is Lord of Casterly Rock, Shield of Lannisport, and Warden of the West. The head of House Lannister, Tywin is one of the most powerful lords in Westeros, and is the father of Jaime, Cersei, and Tyrion Lannister.
+1 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Can see through features and +4 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking.

Stannis Baratheon is the head of House Baratheon of Dragonstone and the Lord of Dragonstone. He is the elder of King Robert I Baratheon's two younger brothers, the youngest being Lord Renly Baratheon. Stannis also serves on Robert's small council as master of ships. His parents were Steffon Baratheon, Lord of Storm's End, and Lady Cassana Estermont.

Olenna Tyrell, also known as Olenna Redwyne, is the widow of Lord Luthor Tyrell and the mother of Mace Tyrell, Lord of Highgarden. Born into House Redwyne of the Arbor, she is commonly known as the Queen of Thorns because of her sharp tongue.

Prince Doran Nymeros Martell is the head of House Martell, the Prince of Dorne, and the Lord of Sunspear. Married to Lady Mellario, of the Free City of Norvos, he has three children: Arianne, Quentyn, and Trystane. While his bannermen might consider him weak, Doran has been focused for years on getting revenge for the murder of his sister, Elia, and her two young children during the Sack of King's Landing in 283 AC.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Desert.

Balon Greyjoy is the head of House Greyjoy of Pyke and is the Lord of the Iron Islands. The captain of the Great Kraken,he is a follower of the Old Way of the ironborn and desires to bring them back to prominence. In 289 AC he proclaimed their independence from the Iron Throne, but Greyjoy's Rebellion was defeated by King Robert I Baratheon's forces.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters and perform costal raids. Can capture defeated enemy naval vessels.

Joffrey Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the eldest son and heir of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. A member of House Baratheon of King's Landing, his siblings are Princess Myrcella and Prince Tommen.Joffrey grew up as a spoiled and indulgent child with a cruel streak within him.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.

The Night King is the leader of the White Walkers. According to the legend, the Other first appear 8.000 ago before the Aegon Conquest, in a winter that last one generation and a period of darkness known as the Long Night. Eventually, thet were defeated by the Night's Watch in the battle for the Dawn. The wall may have been raised to defend against them.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in the Snow or Tundra.
Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged (because they are dead).

Daenerys is the daughter of King Aerys II Targaryen, the last Targaryen king to actually sit in the Iron Throne and rule the Seven Kingdoms, and his sister-wife Rhaella. She was conceived during the last month of the War of the Usurper. Shortly after her conception, her mother and brother Viserys were sent to Dragonstone for safekeeping. Within weeks her father was dead and Robert Baratheon had claimed the throne with the support of most of the nobility.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Unsullied adjacent.
Can move after attacking and heal after defeating an enemy.
Ignores Zona Control, terrains costs and can Attack Walls.

Roose Bolton is the Lord of the Dreadfort and head of House Bolton. He receives regular leechings, which he believes to improve his health, prompting some to call him the Leech Lord. Though mild-mannered, Roose is cold, patient, calculating, and capable of great cruelty. He possesses a cold cunning, a skill for strategy, and a calculating nature.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Dreadfort Pikeman adjacent.
Walder Frey is the Lord of the Crossing and head of House Frey. Though almost ninety years old and infirm, he still maintains an active hand in the running of his house.
Half of the attack of the Crossbowman, but can attack twice per turn.

Jeor Mormont, also known as the Old Bear, is the 997th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, which he commands from their headquarters, Castle Black. Jeor, previously head of House Mormont and Lord of Bear Island, abdicated his seat in favor of his son, Ser Jorah Mormont, and joined the Night's Watch. He rapidly rose through the ranks and was elected Lord Commander in 288 AC.

Mance Rayder was once a man of the Night's Watch before breaking his vows and abandoning his post. He has since become extremely influential among the free folk, and is called the "King-Beyond-the-Wall".
-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.

King Robert I Baratheon is the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros and the head of House Baratheon of King's Landing. Robert was crowned king after winning the rebellion which was named after him and taking the Iron Throne from King Aerys II Targaryen, his first cousin once removed. Robert fought the war to win back his betrothed, Lyanna Stark, with the aid of her brother, his close friend, Lord Eddard Stark. Due to Lyanna's death, however, Robert married Cersei Lannister after war's end to ensure political stability.

Renly Baratheon is the Lord of Storm's End and Lord Paramount of the Stormlands. The younger brother of King Robert I and Lord Stannis, Renly serves as master of laws on Robert's small council.After Robert's death, Renly manages to win the support of powerful House Tyrell and many of their bannermen through a secret love affair with Loras and a marriage to his sister Margaery. Renly is crowned Lord of the Seven Kingdoms at Highgarden.
Drogo is a powerful khal of the fearsome Dothraki nomads. Before the age of thirty he led a khalasar forty thousand strong, the largest on the Dothraki sea. He has never been defeated in battle.
+50% [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield from Commercial Hub buildings and Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 [ICON_FAITH] for you.
Your districts on or next to Coast tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 Food [ICON_Food].
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Gold [ICON_GOLD] and +1 Production [ICON_Production] for you.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RESOURCE_CITRICS] Citrics and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk Luxury resources.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_DYES] Dyes Luxury resource and naval units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk Luxury resources.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Faith [ICON_FAITH] and +1 Production [ICON_Production] for you.
+1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith adjacency bonus from hills to Holy Site
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Science [ICON_SCIENCE] for you.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your Bonus resources behave like Luxury resources, providing 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per type.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for routes between your own cities.
All your districts get +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from adjacent Coast tiles.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through.
Accumulate 20% less war weariness than usual.
Naval Melee units gain 50% more experience than usual.
Ranged land units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Industrial Zones gain +1 [ICON_Production] if next to a river.
+15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when adjacent to rivers.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.
This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.
+7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in the Snow or Tundra, no movement penalty in Hills or Forests.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Eddard Stark is the head of House Stark, Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. He is a close friend to King Robert I Baratheon, with whom he was raised.
Jon Snow is the bastard son of Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell. Jon was raised at Winterfell. At the age of fourteen, he joins the Night's Watch.
Euron Greyjoy is a member of House Greyjoy and is the eldest of Lord Balon Greyjoy's younger brothers. Euron is captain of the Silence, a ship crewed entirely by mutes whose tongues he ripped out.

Lady Lysa Arryn, also known as Lysa Tully, is a member of House Tully. She is the youngest daughter of Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun and his wife, Lady Minisa Whent, and wife of Lord Jon Arryn, the Lord of the Eyrie and Hand of the King to King Robert I Baratheon. Since her husband's death, she is the Lady Regent of the Vale of Arryn.

Cersei Lannister is the only daughter and eldest child of Lord Tywin Lannister of Casterly Rock and his wife, Lady Joanna Lannister. She is the twin of her younger brother, Ser Jaime Lannister. After Robert's Rebellion, Cersei married King Robert I Baratheon and became Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. She is the mother of Prince Joffrey, Princess Myrcella, and Prince Tommen of House Baratheon of King's Landing.

Aegon VI Targaryen was the second child and only son of Prince Rhaegar Targaryen and Elia Martell. During the Sack of King's Landing Ser Gregor Clegane killed Aegon, Rhaenys, and Elia. But Varys says he smuggled the genuine Aegon across the narrow sea and Aegon would have a stronger claim to the Iron Throne that anyone else.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +3 [ICON_Food] Food, and Fresh Water.
“Silverwing at last report had departed the desolation at Tumbleton for the Reach, and was said to have made her lair on a small, stony isle in the middle of Red Lake.”[NEWLINE]– thoughts of Aegon II
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

“Even warring khalasars put aside their feuds and shared meat and mead together when they were in sight of the Mother of Mountains. In this place, the crones of the doshkhaleen had decreed, all Dothraki were one blood, one khalasar, one herd.”[NEWLINE]– thoughts of Daenerys
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

“As Nessaria beat westward, the Dragonmont loomed up before them, huge against the setting sun...and the sailors spied two dragons fighting, their roars echoing off the sheer black cliffs of the smoking mountain’s eastern flanks.”[NEWLINE]– Nessaria sailors tale
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
The Dothraki consider the sea poisonous because their horses cannot drink the saltwater.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

“The shadows covered the floor of the pass by then, and the sun was sinking fast toward the jagged twin peaks of the huge mountain the rangers named Forktop. The last ray of sun vanished behind the peaks of Forktop. Twilight filled the Skirling Pass. It seemed to grow colder almost at once.”[NEWLINE]– Jon describing a wolf dream
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.

“Looming over them all was the jagged peak called the Giant’s Lance, a mountain that even mountains looked up to, its head lost in icy mists three and a half miles above the valley floor. Over its massive western shoulder flowed the ghost torrent of Alyssa’s Tears. Even from this distance, Catelyn could make out the shining silver thread, bright against the dark stone.”[NEWLINE]– thoughts of Catelyn Stark
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

“The histories say the crannogmen grew close to the children of the forest in the days when the greenseers tried to bring the hammer of the waters down upon the Neck. It may be that they have secret knowledge.”[NEWLINE]– Maester Luwin
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.

The Stepstones, the chain of rocky islands between Dorne and the Disputed Lands of Essos, had long been a haunt of outlaws, exiles, wreckers, and pirates. Of themselves the isles were of little worth, but placed as they were, they controlled the sea lanes to and from the narrow sea.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
“Stone, I must be stone, I must be Casterly Rock, hard and unmovable.”[NEWLINE]– thoughts of Tyrion Lannister
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.

For half a moon, they rode through the Forest of Qohor, where the leaves made a golden canopy high above them, and the trunks of the trees were as wide as city gates. There were great elk in that wood, and spotted tigers, and lemurs with silver fur and huge purple eyes, but all fled before the approach of the khalasar and Dany got no glimpse of them.
